title: Induced charge on three identical spheres

content.question: Three identical conducting spheres, I, II, and III, are mounted on insulating stands and placed as shown above. Spheres I and II are each uncharged, and III carries a positive charge. Spheres I and II are connected to each other by a conducting wire. After the wire is removed, sphere III is moved far away. Which of the following statements about the subsequent charges on spheres I and II is correct?

choices.label: They are charged with equal positive charges.
They are charged with equal negative charges.
Sphere I is positively charged and sphere II is negatively charged.
Sphere I is negatively charged and sphere II is positively charged.

content.answer: Sphere I is positively charged and sphere II is negatively charged.
